name: Baked Gobi Manchurian (Cauliflower Manchurian)
description: In this lightened-up take on the Indian-Chinese restaurant favorite Gobi Manchurian, cauliflower florets are baked up until crispy and then drenched in a delicious sweet and spicy sauce! Serve it as an appetizer or main dish. Gluten-free option.Â
recipeIngredient: 1  small head of cauliflower (chopped into florets, 4 cups)
7 tablespoons of flour such as rice flour or all-purpose flour
1/4 cup of cornstarch or other starch such as tapioca starch
1 inch knob of ginger peeled and finely chopped
1/2  of a green or red chili seeded and finely chopped
1/2 cup finely chopped red or white onion
1/2 cup finely chopped green bell pepper
1 tablespoon Asian Chili Sauce such as Sambal Oelek or other
2 teaspoons white vinegar or apple cider vinegar

recipeInstructions.text: Add all the dry ingredients for the batter in a bowl and mix well(flour, starch, garlic powder, salt, baking powder). Add the soy sauce, oil, and 1/3 cup water, and mix. Add water 1 tbsp at a time to make a thick smooth batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Add all the dry ingredients for the batter in a bowl and mix well(flour, starch, garlic powder, salt, baking powder). Add the soy sauce, oil, and 1/3 cup water, and mix. Add water 1 tbsp at a time to make a thick smooth batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Add cauliflower florets to the bowl and toss to coat. Sprinkle panko aon the florets. Transfer to parchment-lined baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cauliflower florets to the bowl and toss to coat. Sprinkle panko aon the florets. Transfer to parchment-lined baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 415 F(210 C) for 25-28 minutes. Check if the cauliflower is done at 25 mins. Remove from the oven when done and set aside
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 415 F(210 C) for 25-28 minutes. Check if the cauliflower is done at 25 mins. Remove from the oven when done and set aside

itemListElement.text: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic, ginger, and chilis and stir. Cook until the garlic is golden ,2-3 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic, ginger, and chilis and stir. Cook until the garlic is golden ,2-3 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Add the onion, bell pepper, and celery  and cook until golden . 8 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Add the onion, bell pepper, and celery  and cook until golden . 8 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Add in the sauces. The Asian chili sauce, soy sauce, ketchup, vinegar, black pepper, and sugar and bring it to a boil.
itemListElement.name: Add in the sauces. The Asian chili sauce, soy sauce, ketchup, vinegar, black pepper, and sugar and bring it to a boil.

itemListElement.text: Mix together corn starch in 1/2 cup of water then add it to the skillet. Cook until the sauce comes to a good boil and thickens. Taste and adjust seasoning. Adjusting the soy sauce for salt and heat with black pepper or Asian Chili Sauce.
itemListElement.name: Mix together corn starch in 1/2 cup of water then add it to the skillet. Cook until the sauce comes to a good boil and thickens. Taste and adjust seasoning. Adjusting the soy sauce for salt and heat with black pepper or Asian Chili Sauce.

itemListElement.text: Once thickened, add your baked cauliflower and toss to coat. Top with green onions and serve.
itemListElement.name: Once thickened, add your baked cauliflower and toss to coat. Top with green onions and serve.
